caption.p: ( a, b) Mean (marker) and ±1 standard deviation (whiskers) values of the aerosol-CIs during the study period (2000–2015). Upward and downward facing triangles indicate significant positive and negative trends as determined using Kendall’s tau-b, while square markers indicate no significant trend (at α = 0.05). ( c) Percentage change per year in the CIs estimated using a linear regression fit (shown in Figures S2 and S3). The middle circles denote the normalized regression slopes (i.e. trends), and the inner and outer circles are the lower and upper bounds, respectively, of the 95% confidence intervals of these slopes. Black circles indicate trends that are not significant at α = 0.05.
